src:
Jokowi Gelar Pertemuan dengan PM Australia, Apa yang Dibahas?
04 Nov 2019, 15:00 by Andhika Prasetia


Foto: Pertemuan Indonesia-Australia (Tim Infografis: Andhika Akbarayansyah)

Jakarta - Di sela-sela pelaksanaan Konferensi Tingkat Tinggi (KTT) ke-35 ASEAN, Presiden Joko Widodo mengadakan pertemuan dengan PM Australia Scott Morrison pada Senin, 4 November 2019.Pertemuan tersebut dihelat di ruang pertemuan yang ada di Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand.Dalam pertemuan itu, Jokowi menegaskan kembali komitmen Indonesia untuk perkuat kemitraan strategis komprehensif dengan Australia.Dalam lingkup bilateral, Jokowi menyambut baik proses ratifikasi IA-CEPA di parlemen Australia."Proses ratifikasi IA-CEPA di Indonesia akan dilakukan segera," ucap Jokowi.Sementara itu PM Morrison menyambut baik komitmen Jokowi tersebut. "Saya berharap akhir tahun ini bisa selesai karena saya melihat sudah tidak ada lagi perbedaan pandangan," kata Morrison.Dalam pertemuan, Jokowi berbagi informasi mengenai hasil kunjungan ke Papua tanggal 26-28 Oktober 2019."Papua adalah provinsi pertama yang saya kunjungi setelah saya dilantik. Alhamdullilah saat ini situasi Papua dan Papua Barat telah kembali normal. Aktivitas ekonomi telah berjalan kembali," ujar Presiden Jokowi.Dalam kunjungan tersebut, Jokowi menyampaikan dirinya telah meresmikan Jembatan Youtefa yang menghubungkan Kota Jayapura dengan Distrik Muara Tami."Saya juga resmikan Pusat Pengembangan start-up Pemuda Papua, Papuan Youth Creative Hub. Dua hal tersebut merupakan manisfestasi komitmen saya untuk membangun Papua," ucap Jokowi.Masyarakat Papua juga masih sangat mengharapkan agar lebih banyak jalan dan infrastruktur lain dapat dibangun di Papua. "Keamanan yang sudah pulih ini akan kita jaga," tutur Jokowi.PM Morrison menyampaikan apresiasinya atas kunjungan yang dilakukan Jokowi ke Papua. "Kunjungan Papua dan komitmen Presiden Jokowi untuk membangun Papua sangat bermanfaat," ucap PM Morrison."Terima kasih telah berbagi hasil kunjungan ke Papua," kata PM Morrison.Terakhir, Presiden juga menyampaikan apresiasinya kepada Pemerintah Australia atas dukungannya kepada Indonesia pada pemilihan anggota Dewan HAM PBB."Terima kasih atas dukungan Australia terhadap pencalonan Indonesia," ujar Jokowi. Simak Video "Pakar Nilai Alasan Jokowi Belum Keluarkan Perppu Mengada-ada"[Gambas:Video 20detik](dkp/dna)
text:
Jokowi Holds Meeting with Australian PM, What Is Discussed?
Nov 04 2019, 3:00 PM by Andhika Prasetia


Photo: Indonesia-Australia Meeting (Infographic Team: Andhika Akbarayansyah)

Jakarta - On the sidelines of the implementation of the 35th ASEAN Summit, President Joko Widodo held a meeting with Australian PM Scott Morrison on Monday, November 4, 2019. The meeting was held in the conference room at the Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand. During the meeting, Jokowi reiterated Indonesia's commitment to strengthen a comprehensive strategic partnership with Australia. Within the bilateral scope, Jokowi welcomed the IA-CEPA ratification process in the Australian parliament. "The IA-CEPA ratification process in Indonesia will be carried out soon," Jokowi said. Meanwhile PM Morrison welcomed Jokowi's commitment. "I hope the end of this year can be finished because I see that there are no more differences of opinion," Morrison said. During the meeting, Jokowi shared information about the results of a visit to Papua on October 26-28, 2019. "Papua is the first province I visited after I Thank God now the situation in Papua and West Papua has returned to normal. Economic activity has been running again, "said President Jokowi. During the visit, Jokowi said he had inaugurated the Youtefa Bridge connecting Jayapura City with Muara Tami District." I also inaugurated the Center The development of the Papua Youth start-up, Papuan Youth Creative Hub. These two things are manifestation of my commitment to develop Papua, "said Jokowi. The Papuan people also still highly expect that more roads and other infrastructure can be built in Papua. "We will protect the recovered security," Jokowi said. PM Morrison expressed his appreciation for Jokowi's visit to Papua. "Papua's visit and President Jokowi's commitment to develop Papua are very beneficial," said Prime Minister Morrison. "Thank you for sharing the results of the visit to Papua," PM Morrison said. Finally, the President also expressed his appreciation to the Australian Government for its support for Indonesia in the selection of Council members. "Thank you for Australia's support for Indonesia's candidacy," Jokowi said. Check out the video "Expert Value Reasons Jokowi Has Not Yet Issued Perppu Made Up" [Gambas: Video 20second] (dkp / dna)
